title: Enable tsdoc:check strictNullChecks
description:
Enable `strictNullChecks` and `strictFunctionTypes` in `tsconfig.jsdoc.json` and track their downstream tsdoc fallout. This issue now behaves as an epic whose children address the remaining failures:
- `dadeto-oul` (data/localStorage/storageLens)
- `dadeto-98t` (presenter JSDoc)
- `dadeto-ho5` & `dadeto-qlq` (toy helpers, including cyberpunk data)
- `dadeto-ahx` (tags DOM helper typings)
- `dadeto-nmo` (cloud render/submit helper typings)
Close this epic once all of the child beads are resolved.

title: Enable tsdoc:check noImplicitReturns
description: Enable noImplicitReturns so tsdoc:check ensures every declared return path yields a value; add follow-on beads for the type errors reported afterward.

title: Document presenter JSDoc descriptors
description: ESLint now warns inside  about missing  descriptions for / and missing / text around line 154. Add the missing descriptions and clarify the parse helper's signature so the lint warning disappears.

title: Enable tsdoc:check alwaysStrict
description: Enable alwaysStrict so every file is processed in strict mode and add follow-up beads for any tsdoc check failures that surface.

title: dedupe core browser tags
description: there is a clone reported by npm run duplication for src core browser tags
acceptance_criteria: the clone no longer appears in the npm run duplication output

comments.author: matthew.heard
comments.text: Changes: collapsed hide-by-class helpers in src/core/browser/tags.js and documented the requirement to mark beads in progress in AGENTS.md. Commands run: npm test; npm run duplication. Outcomes: tests pass (100% coverage) and duplication now only flags existing clones in src/core/browser/localStorageLens.js. Follow-up: consider deduping localStorageLens.js in a new bead if desired.

title: Fix tsdoc:check failures
description: npm run tsdoc:check (tsc --project tsconfig.jsdoc.json) started failing because of many type mismatches across core/browser and core/cloud modules (e.g., NormalizedBlogDataDependencies vs BlogDataDependencies in src/core/browser/data.js, DOM helper shapes in src/core/browser/tags.js, and numerous inference errors in core/cloud/render-variant-core.js and submit-new-page/story helpers). Sweep these errors or relax the tsconfig so the script passes.

title: Document tags DOM helpers
description: tsdoc:check now shows ~40 errors in src/core/browser/tags.js because every DOM helper is inferred as plain object (missing hasClass/hide/addClass/appendChild/etc) and the click handler parameters are implicit any. Declare typed helper objects (DOMHelpers/LinkHelpers) and annotate the params so the compiler no longer flags those methods when scanning tags.js; run npm run tsdoc:check to verify.

comments.author: matthew.heard
comments.text: Typed the DOM helper bag that tags rely on, annotated each helper with the new contract, and reran npm test + npm run tsdoc:check (still fails because presenter/toy/cloud backlog remains).

title: Add types to data/localStorageLens helpers
description:
With `noImplicitAny` enabled (and `checkJs` re-enabled) `npm run tsdoc:check` now stops almost immediately with the data helpers:

- `src/core/browser/data.js(480,3)`: `tsc` treats the decoded state as `unknown` before it is read as an object.
- `src/core/browser/localStorageLens.js(56|67|203)`: the stored slot is assigned to `string` but is still seen as `unknown`.

Type the reader/decoder so the result is narrowed (e.g., describe the `BlogStateRecord` shape or a tighter DTO) and keep the runtime guards for missing JSON/storage. The helpers should only expose the actual properties so downstream code never passes `unknown` into `Object.assign`/`JSON.parse`.

Acceptance criteria:
* JSDoc signatures (or helper typedefs) describe the stored data and the return value of `localStorageLens`.
* The places that `tsdoc:check` flagged no longer emit TypeScript errors.
* Behavior for missing storage or corrupt payloads remains unchanged and is documented in the new typedef comment.

title: Enable tsdoc:check strictPropertyInitialization
description: Enable strictPropertyInitialization and capture the list of errors from npm run tsdoc:check for follow-up beads.

title: Enable tsdoc:check noFallthroughCasesInSwitch
description: Enable noFallthroughCasesInSwitch so switch statements must explicitly break, and create beads for any tsdoc violations that appear once the flag is on.

title: Enable tsdoc:check noImplicitAny
description: Enable the noImplicitAny flag in tsconfig.jsdoc.json and capture the first batch of errors reported by npm run tsdoc:check so each can become its own follow-up bead.

title: Document tags DOM helper types
description: tsdoc:check flags src/core/browser/tags.js for implicit any parameters, untyped helper shapes, and missing DOM helper signatures once strictNullChecks/strictFunctionTypes are on. Declare the helper API and DOM argument shapes so the compiler knows about HTMLElement/Event callbacks and no longer warns about implicit anys.

title: Enable tsdoc:check noImplicitThis
description: Turn on noImplicitThis in the tsdoc compiler and create child beads for each failure reported after running npm run tsdoc:check.

title: Document tags DOM helper types
description: tsdoc:check flags  for implicit  parameters, untyped helper object shapes, and missing DOM helper signatures once strictNullChecks/strictFunctionTypes are enabled. Declare the DOM helper API and parameter shapes so the compiler sees the expected / signatures and no longer warns about implicit s.

title: Tighten moderation/authedFetch signatures
description:
The tsdoc:check output now highlights several overload/type mismatches inside `src/core/browser/moderation/authedFetch.js` (after `checkJs`/`noImplicitAny` were re-enabled):

- lines 15-44: `Object.fromEntries` is passed a function that returns `HeadersIterator<[string,string]>`, which is currently typed too loosely for `tsc`.
- lines 66-96: options/responses are treated as bare `object`s, so `ok`, `status`, and `json` are marked as missing.

The helper should declare the exact headers/resolver shapes in JSDoc so `tsdoc:check` sees the runtime structure and stop complaining about the iterator + missing fields. Guard the error path so the compiler knows `Error` instances have a `status` when they are used like one.

Acceptance criteria:
* The iterator passed to `Object.fromEntries` has a callable signature that satisfies `Iterable<readonly [PropertyKey, any]>`.
* The `fetch` options/response/resolver signatures include the `ok`, `status`, and `json` properties needed by the helper.
* Any explicit `Error` usage is narrowed before accessing `status` so `tsc` stops flagging the invalid property.

title: Typedef toy helpers for tsdoc
description:
Early tsdoc failures also highlight the toy helpers under `src/core/browser/toys`:

- `2025-03-21/italics.js` and `fishingGame.js` use `Array` without type arguments and treat generated nodes as `object` scraps (`beforeText`, `boldText`, `row`, `col`, etc.).
- `2025-03-29/get.js` flows throw away the expected `{ value, path, error }` shape and treat the accumulator as `object`, while `2025-03-30/cyberpunkAdventure.js` indexes maps with `string` keys that no longer exist in the inferred literal types.

Add targeted typedefs or JSDoc comments that describe the toy payloads plus the DOM helpers so `tsdoc:check` sees the actual shapes instead of `object`. Refactor the helpers to respect those typed structures rather than relying on implicit `any`.

Acceptance criteria:
* Each toy helper documents the input/output object shape (e.g., `ItalicRow`, `FishingMood`, `ParsedGetSegment`).
* The DOM elements they build are passed around as typed helpers (so `createElement`, `setTextContent`, `appendChild` are recognized).
* The current tsdoc errors for these toy files disappear while the rest of the log remains unchanged.

title: Handle TCR commit failures
description: The current tcr script always prints 'Changes committed successfully' even when git commit fails (e.g., .git/index.lock permission). Update tcr.sh to verify git commit exit status before reporting success and surface the failure to the caller so it doesnâ€™t mislead users.

title: Tsdoc: tighten cloud render/submit helpers
description: strict flags highlight many type mismatches inside src/core/cloud/render-variant/render-variant-core.js, submit-new-page helpers, and submit-new-story core (unknown objects, missing firestore methods, and untyped HTTP responses). Add the missing typedefs/signatures so tsdoc sees the actual DOM methods, Firestore helpers, and HTTP response shapes and the compiler stops complaining about the `object` vs typed structures.

title: Tsdoc: narrow blog data/runtime storage types
description: strictNullChecks is now enabled, so the errors at src/core/browser/data.js (memoryLens null), src/core/browser/localStorageLens.js (nullable strings), and src/core/browser/storageLens.js (setter type mismatch) must be addressed by tightening the helper typedefs so they never expose null where undefined is expected.

title: Fix tic tac toe board JSDoc and complexity
description: ESLint now flags  for missing property/parameter descriptions, the missing  on the move filter helper, the complexity of , and the ternary inside . Document the properties, add the missing , and refactor those helpers so they stay within the allowed complexity while keeping behavior stable.

title: Type cyberpunkAdventure story data
description: tsdoc:check reports errors in src/core/browser/toys/2025-03-30/cyberpunkAdventure.js (string index usage at lines ~67/231 and untyped story state objects around lines 255-389). Introduce explicit state/context typedefs for the adventure map, guard lookups, and annotate the payload so tsdoc sees the actual {name,state,inventory,visited} shape instead of object. Verify with npm run tsdoc:check to keep these failures from reappearing.

title: Deduplicate localStorageLens helper
description: npm run duplication (jscpd) detected copies inside src/core/browser/localStorageLens.js: [45:13-54:4] vs [92:18-102:4] and [74:4-86:4] vs [160:33-169:4]. Extract or share the repeated logic so the duplication report goes away.

title: Enable tsdoc:check strictBindCallApply
description: Enable strictBindCallApply in tsconfig.jsdoc.json and capture any tsdoc issues for later beads.

title: Document presenter DOM helpers
description:
The first batch of tsdoc failures now falls inside the presenter helpers:

- `src/core/browser/presenters/battleshipSolitaireClues.js` reports dozens of missing properties/implicit anys (`rowClues`, `colClues`, `Array<T>` generics, unnamed parameter types).
- `src/core/browser/presenters/ticTacToeBoard.js` and `src/core/browser/tags.js` also show `tsc` treating DOM helpers as plain `object` and reporting implicit `any` parameters (e.g., `position`, `player`, `event`).

We need to declare shared DOM helper typedefs (`DOMHelpers`, `TextHelpers`, etc.) and annotate each exported helper so the compiler knows the exact properties and removes the `unknown`/`object` errors. In particular, the presenter functions should accept typed `options` with `rowClues`, `colClues`, and the DOM `container` helper should list `createElement`/`setTextContent`/`addEventListener` so uses of those properties stop being flagged.

Acceptance criteria:
* Each presenter helper has a documented parameter shape (e.g., `@typedef {object} BattleshipCluePayload`) that lists the needed arrays/fields.
* The DOM helper objects passed into the presenters expose explicit members instead of being inferred as `object`.
* The `tsdoc:check` run that currently produces these errors no longer reports them (the rest of the log can still fail elsewhere).

comments.author: matthew.heard
comments.text:
Documented the presenter payload shapes and DOM helpers, reran
